result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Lamont Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Lamont Thomas in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for David Lamont Thomas.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lamont Thomas in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for David Lamont Thomas.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel provides an update to the Court and requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Lamont Thomas in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Court is advised that the defendant still has yet to be represented by SPD in this court matter. Court orders defendant to be re-interviewed by SPD. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/07/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RST.

Defendant David Lamont Thomas in court.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/5/22 @ 2p
